content: sw614 Posted Tue 12 May 2009 08:00 PM I once found $20 in the dryer. Maybe they should check there! They can not keep track of expenditures now and some want them to run health care? Great... You better have a real big dryer sw. Someone sent me an e-mail of a picture of one billion dollars in Hundred dollar bills stacked on pallets 2 high 6'X 16' X 200+' And it was mind staggering to imagine 12,000 times that size. But then thats chump change the way they toss money around today. I remember as a kid they had a call in Radio show the 25,000 dollar jackpot. People would tune in and fantasize what the would do with 25,000 dollars. Retire was always the first thing then buy a lavish house, and a new car, cruise the world, and take care of all thier relatives. that I believe was in the late forties. today that dont even buy a luxury used car. How times have changed.

content: Yeah it is amazing that with all the accountants the government employs they can not find the paper trail on money that equals 75% of the national debt. Bigger dryer? Oh, no. With the way we are going, all we have to do is actually make money's physical size relative to its market worth. Then it would all fit in a dryer. I too remember those days of Dialing for Dollars, Bowling for Dollars, etc. It was something the way people would get all giddy over a few hundred, $5K, $10K, etc. Kinda miss that.....
reply: Yeah it is amazing that with all the accountants the government employs they can not find the paper trail on money that equals 75% of the national debt. Bigger dryer? Oh, no.
